location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 16 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is forwarding a dispatch (not present) from the Resident at Bussorah [Basra]. It notes that the Bussorah Resident has requested the presence of a ship to protect trade and the Residency. Therefore, John Macleod has requested that a cruizer is dispatched to Bussorah whenever one can be spared.
